intro: Guettarda rhamnifolia, commonly known as the Florida hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a rough texture, while its stems are often woody and branched. Guettarda rhamnifolia is often used in ornamental gardening due to its aesthetic appeal and adaptability to various growing conditions.
